bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, July 28, 1915

div1.p: Carter describes life in the camp and the field. He does not know when he will be home again.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, July 28, 1915
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE.
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
??? ??? SC
July 27/15
28/15
My Dear Awwie:
div1.p:
This too will be only a 1/2 a letter as I
am writing it before breakfast & we
have breakfast at 6. I got back tired
last night, & could not write. I al-
ways have a lot of field-notes etc to
transcribe when I get back.

I was extremely glad to here from
your last letter which was a full
& satisfactory one - how much you
enjoyed having your sisters
with you. I am glad that you can
have this pleasure. No doubt
but that they enjoy it also. Louise
Louise however has by no means
the associations in Baltimore
that Sally has & except for your-
self will the sooner tire of it.
She is very fortunate in having
two of her daughters living
in the same town with her for
Norfolk & Portsmouth are really
one town - & in the presence of
the grand-children

I rec'd Henry's letter - a pleas-
ant one full of good news a-
bout his work at Hopkins - last
night. Also one from Laura
written from West Annapolis
-Mrs.
Mrs Lackey's - in which
she said she would come back to
the Hospital today. Naturally
she will be there long before
you get this.

I think we will not finish this
pond until Monday night.
Possibly not until Tuesday
night- Well we are purposing
to do a thorough job - on it &
are not intending to return &
we will finish it sometime

The living - food: lodging etc are
better here than we are likely to
strike & the nights have all been
cool. So while I will be glad to
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE.
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
BALTIMORE, MD.
have this unit off of my
hand I may be sorry to have
the next one. This will be
Stevens Creek - an branch of
the Savannah River- Just
above Augusta Ga..

I will be home after a while, where
I do not exactly know - but I wish
I were there now-
